Release and Distribution (P1)

Easy installation and updates using standard package managers.

WHY THIS PRIORITY: Easy installation through package managers significantly lowers the barrier to adoption and ensures users can quickly get updates.

INDEPENDENT TEST: Install the project using Homebrew and verify installation works correctly.

- Update GoReleaser configuration verification
- Verify Homebrew tap functionality
- Test release process with dry-run

WHAT: Review and update SECURITY.md to ensure it covers all necessary aspects.

title: Add validation for artifact_path field

description: Main login command with browser flow

Create .golangci.yml configuration file with standard Go linters (gofmt, govet, staticcheck, errcheck, gosimple, ineffassign, unused, gosec).

WHY: Establish consistent code quality standards across the project.

Includes 3 new commands, updates to 2 existing commands, Purpose sections added to all commands, 2 new utility scripts, and bash script path corrections.

WHAT: Verify existing .goreleaser.yaml includes build targets, checksums, and Homebrew configuration.

title: CLI Authentication
description: Add browser-based OAuth authentication to SpecLedger CLI for accessing protected features like private specifications and remote synchronization. Includes local callback server, secure credential storage, token refresh, and CI/CD headless authentication options.

description: Update metadata schema to support artifact_path for projects and dependencies. Add ArtifactPath to ProjectMetadata, remove Path from Dependency, update validation and loading logic.

title: Release Delivery Fix
description: Fix release delivery system for macOS - ensure users can install via binary download, shell script, Homebrew, and go install. Focus on darwin_amd64 and darwin_arm64.

title: US1: Help Command
description: A developer new to SpecLedger wants to quickly discover available commands and understand the workflow. Provide a /specledger.help command that displays all commands organized by workflow stage.

title: User Story 6: Update SpecLedger-Deps Skill Documentation

title: Open Source Readiness
description:
Prepare SpecLedger project for open source release by establishing legal compliance, documentation, contributor onboarding, release automation, and community infrastructure.

This feature adds:
- Legal files: NOTICE, GOVERNANCE.md
- CI/CD quality workflow with golangci-lint
- README badges (build, coverage, license, version)
- Documentation structure for specledger.io/docs
- Codecov integration for coverage tracking

Project is 90%+ ready with existing LICENSE, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, SECURITY.md, CONTRIBUTING.md, GoReleaser, and Homebrew tap.
